text:
Professional
Councils
Now in the third year of existence, the Professional Council structure of the
NAEB has become the basis for the successful and valuable involvement of the
individual member in the operation of the Association. The Professional Councils
allow for a direct and intense interaction between people with similar interests in
public telecommunications. . ..
Each member of the NAEB is eligible to participate in Professional Council
activities. Council members elect a Steering Committee and are consulted on a
variety of matters affecting NAEB services and policies in a particular professional
ar Council members are urged to participate in the planning of the NAEB Annual
Convention as well as the development of the Educational Broadcasting Institute
(EBI) topics and seminars. Council members also are asked to serve as advisors on
special projects and to develop procedures to provide recognition and awards tor
achievement in areas pertinent to Council interests.
Where the Council are clearly related to professional positions, a primary and
secondary affiliation can be moted so that it will be possible to distinguish those
who are associated with the Council because of position from those who are
simply interested in the topic and wish to be better informed.
The listings which follow, which include names and state of residency, report
only what the members have indentified as their first choice of a Professional
Council.
Broadcast Education
